definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook
to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook

sentences.english: His eyes were fixed on the place where the path disappeared into the fog.
sentences.chinese: 他的雙眼直勾勾地盯着這條小路被大霧遮沒之處。
他直勾勾地盯着遠處看。

sentences.english: He looked at him with his eyes very flat .
sentences.chinese: 他眼睛直勾勾地盯着他。

sentences.english: He looked Karkov squarely in the eye.
sentences.chinese: 他眼睛直勾勾地盯着他。

sentences.english: He looked straight into his adjutant's face and did not recognise him.
sentences.chinese: 他直勾勾地望着他的副官的面孔，沒有認出他是誰。

definition: unable to take one's eyes off (idiom); to gaze steadily/to stare
to stare/to look blank/to be fixed (of eyes)
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
see 色瞇瞇|色眯眯[se4 mi1 mi1]
